member.summary: OptimizeClipRendering Dependency Property

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.ClipBorder.OptimizeClipRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the OptimizeClipRendering property. This dependency property indicates whether the rendering of the clip should be optimized. When set to true, In order to optimize the rendering of the clipped Child, the background is rendered with the same brush as the border. Any other brush set for the background will be ignored. The Child will be rendered on top of it. This is done to prevent any gaps between the border the the clipped Child (this is evidently visible if both the Border and the Child are of same color). This works best when the Child does not have any level of transparency and is opaque.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.ClipBorder.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Updates DesiredSize of the ClipBorder. Called by parent UIElement. This is the first pass of layout.
member.remarks: Border determines its desired size it needs from the specified border the child: its sizing properties, margin, and requested size.
member.param: Constraint size is an "upper limit" that the return value should not exceed.
member.returns: The Decorator's desired size.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.ClipBorder.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: ClipBorder computes the position of its single child and applies its child's alignments to the child.
member.param: The size reserved for this element by the parent
member.returns: The actual ink area of the element, typically the same as finalSize

member.summary: Here the ClipBorder's Child, Border and Background are rendered.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.ColorHelper.ColorFromString(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Nullable{System.Windows.Media.Color},System.String})
member.summary: This function tries to convert a given string into a Color in the following order: 1. If the string starts with '#' the function tries to get the color from the hex-code 2. else the function tries to find the color in the color names Dictionary 3. If 1. + 2. were not successful the function adds a '#' sign and tries 1. + 2. again
member.param: The localized name of the color, the hex-code of the color or the internal color name
Optional: The dictionary where the ColorName should be looked up
member.returns: the Color if successful, else null

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.ColorHelper.ColorFromString(System.String)
member.summary: This function tries to convert a given string into a Color in the following order: 1. If the string starts with '#' the function tries to get the color from the hex-code 2. else the function tries to find the color in the default 3. If 1. + 2. were not successful the function adds a '#' sign and tries 1. + 2. again
member.param: The localized name of the color, the hex-code of the color or the internal color name

This ensures that the first hour that is selectable is 12 (AM/PM).
This comparer is used only if in the corresponding the value for is false.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.UnderlinedType
member.summary: Specifies the underline position of a TabControl.

members.member:
Sets the Style and Template property to null.
Removing a TabItem in code behind can produce such nasty output System.Windows.Data Warning: 4 : Cannot find source for binding with reference 'RelativeSource FindAncestor, AncestorType='System.Windows.Controls.TabControl', AncestorLevel='1''. BindingExpression:Path=Background; DataItem=null; target element is 'TabItem' (Name=''); target property is 'Background' (type 'Brush') or System.Windows.Data Error: 4 : Cannot find source for binding with reference 'RelativeSource FindAncestor, AncestorType='System.Windows.Controls.TabControl', AncestorLevel='1''. BindingExpression:Path=(0); DataItem=null; target element is 'TabItem' (Name=''); target property is 'UnderlineBrush' (type 'Brush')
This is a timing problem in WPF of the binding mechanism itself.
To avoid this, we can set the Style and Template to null.

If the value is false then the value changes only if the control has the focus.
If is set to "false" then this property has no effect.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Overlay
member.summary: The pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The pane is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactOverlay
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactInline
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane pushes the content to the side when it's open and takes up space in the control layout.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.TryFindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Finds a parent of a given item on the visual tree.
member.typeparam: The type of the queried item.
member.param: A direct or indirect child of the queried item.
member.returns: The first parent item that matches the submitted type parameter. If not matching item can be found, a null reference is being returned.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.GetAncestors(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Finds all Ancestors of a given item on the visual tree.
member.param: A node in a visual tree
member.returns: All ancestors in visual tree of element

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.GetVisualAncestry(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary:
Returns full visual ancestry, starting at the leaf.
If element is not of or the logical ancestry is used.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.GetVisualAncestor``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary:
Tries to find and returns a visual ancestor, starting at the leaf.
If element is not of or the logical ancestry is used.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.FindChild``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.String)
member.summary: Finds a Child of a given item in the visual tree.
member.param: A direct parent of the queried item.
member.typeparam: The type of the queried item.
member.returns: The first parent item that matches the submitted type parameter. If not matching item can be found, a null parent is being returned.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.GetParentObject(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: This method is an alternative to WPF's method, which also supports content elements. Keep in mind that for content element, this method falls back to the logical tree of the element!
member.returns: The submitted item's parent, if available. Otherwise null.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.FindChildren``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Analyzes both visual and logical tree in order to find all elements of a given type that are descendants of the item.
member.typeparam: The type of the queried items.
member.param: The root element that marks the source of the search. If the source is already of the requested type, it will not be included in the result.
Sometimes it's better to search in the VisualTree (e.g. in tests)
member.returns: All descendants of that match the requested type.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.GetChildObjects(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method is an alternative to WPF's method, which also supports content elements. Keep in mind that for content elements, this method falls back to the logical tree of the element.
member.param: Sometimes it's better to search in the VisualTree (e.g. in tests)
member.returns: The submitted item's child elements, if available.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Controls.TreeHelper.TryFindFromPoint``1(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Tries to locate a given item within the visual tree, starting with the dependency object at a given position.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to be found on the visual tree of the element at the given location.
member.param: The main element which is used to perform hit testing.
The position to be evaluated on the origin.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.MahAppsMetro.Converters.MathConverter
member.summary: MathConverter provides a value converter which can be used for math operations. It can be used for normal binding or multi binding as well. If it is used for normal binding the given parameter will be used as operands with the selected operation. If it is used for multi binding then the first and second binding will be used as operands with the selected operation. This class cannot be inherited.
